Top Rated 5 Gas Grills Under 500 Dollars In 2018

November 18, 2018March 16, 2018 by Jack Thompson
31shares
  • Facebook4
  • Pinterest27
  • Twitter
  • Google+

Are you in the market for a grill that won’t break the bank? Maybe you want to start hosting events and parties at your house and want to accommodate your guests with the best food you are able to put forth.
Or maybe you just want the option to grill your foods in the privacy of your own home. This article will help you to find the best purchasing options for the best gas grill under $500.

If you love to grill and are looking to purchase one, then you have come to the right place! Buying a grill can seem quite daunting. Especially if you don’t know what you are looking for or have a good idea of what grill will best fit your needs. There are many different options available to you and each grill is designed to fit a different function.

For a beginner, the best option to choose will be a gas grill. The reason being is the convenience and easy to follow the functions they provide. Gas grills are also cheaper to maintain than most other grills.

A single propane tank could last you all summer if you are only grilling 2-3 times per week. The cleaning and upkeep will be minimal at best as well.

We know there are many different models out there. So here is a list of the Best Gas Grills under $500 in 2018.

Reviews of the Best Gas Grills under $500 for 2018

1. Char-Broil Signature TRU-Infrared 325 2-Burner Cabinet Liquid Propane Gas Grill

Let’s begin with a great budget grill produced by Char-Broil. This grill is a much smaller sized grill but is still a great option to fulfill your grilling needs. Char-Broil is a company that has been creating grills and burners of all types for over 70 years, so it’s sure to be a well-designed quality product.

This elegant and sturdy built grill provides a large main cooking surface area. It also features two stainless steel tube burners with porcelain-coated cast iron grates, which makes them resistant to rust and very easy to clean.

It also includes a swing-away rack where you can keep food warm or use as a secondary cooking area. The equipped thermometer goes only up to 650 F, but there really is not any food you will be cooking that will exceed a temperature of 500 degrees.

It has two metallic side shelves that give you plenty of space for preparing your food or for keeping your cooking utensils. These shelves can be folded down so that it’s easier to move your grill around or for when you need to store it.

One of the selling points of this grill is the Char-Broil TRU-Infrared cooking system, which allows for better temperature control and distributes heat evenly across the cooking surface area. This will ensure your food to not only cook faster and more evenly but also use less gas.

You can also convert this grill from propane to the best natural gas grill under $500 with a conversion kit, which is sold separately. Considering all its features, this is definitely the best gas grill for the money.

Pros

  • Great build quality
  • Infrared technology cooks food faster
  • Can be converted to natural gas

Cons

  • The included thermometer only goes up to 650 F
Check Price on Amazon

2. Fuego Element F21C Carbon Steel Gas Grill

This cheap grill is sure to turn some heads. The Fuego Element model has a very interesting design. If you saw it at the store you would probably think to yourself, “What on Earth is that?” It looks more like something ready to be launched into space rather than something you would use for cooking.

Although it looks very compact from the outside, it retains enormous space on the inside. Even with its small footprint, it has a large cooking surface area with a porcelain enameled cast iron cooking grate. With its powerful burners, this grill can reach very high temperatures in a short amount of time.

The actual design is not just about how it looks but also about providing balanced heat when cooking. With the usage of two circular burners and a semi-spherical cover, heat is allowed to flow evenly inside the grill.

Not only is it compact but it’s also very light allowing it to be moved around easily using the included wheels, which also lock when you need to provide stability. This absolutely is one of the best gas grills under $400.

If you live in an apartment or have limited patio space available then this is the grill for you. Its small size makes it the perfect grill if you are a little bit space-constrained.

Pros

  • Unique, stylish design
  • It does not take up much space
  • Easy assembly

Cons

  • Does not include a cover
  • The lid handle gets very hot
  • Not fit to stay outside all the time
Check Price on Amazon

3. Weber 46100001 Spirit S210 Liquid Propane Gas Grill

This grill does not come cheap but does get you more bang for your buck. The best propane grill for under $500 features a stylish and durable stainless steel design. You’re sure to be enjoying this grill for many years to come.

Weber has been making grills for over 50 years, so they know a little bit about it, and it shows.

The grill has two powerful burners also made of stainless steel, which can be controlled individually with knobs that rotate 270 degrees providing a much better heat control. The burners are sufficiently spaced to cover the entire cooking surface area.

The burners provide evenly-distributed heat across porcelain enameled cast iron cooking grates which can be used in any sort of weather and are easy to clean.

It has plenty of grilling space to make use of its beefy burners. The grill includes a warming rack as well as two foldable side panels with hooks for extra preparation space. Having said that, the hanging hooks are not too conveniently designed but can be utilized in an array of fashions.

The superior-quality materials this grill is created from require little to no maintenance making it perfect for outdoor use all year round. This grill is made to resist the outdoor elements ensuring that it lasts a long time. The perfect combination of style and performance.

A fuel gauge is also included, so you always know precisely how much you have available.

With all that is has to offer, this sure is one of the best propane grills under $500.

Pros

  • Durable & weather resistant construction
  • Enough space for grilling
  • Fuel gauge

Cons

  • One igniter for the two burners
  • It’s a little difficult to get the gas tank in
  • Inconvenient design of the hanging hooks
Check Price on Amazon

4. Char-Broil Classic 4-Burner Gas Grill with Side Burner

This beautiful grill is manufactured by Char-Broil. A very long time standing company that knows what they are doing when it comes to grills and smokers.

This is one of the more classic styled, powerful, mid-priced grills coming in right under $500.

The four burners deliver a lot of heating power across the spacious main cooking surface area. And we mean a lot of power. In terms of BTU, this is the most powerful grill on the market. It also has the largest cooking surface area, so it does need all that power.

This grill has it all in terms of features! In fact, it has some features that you may not even find in the more expensive grills.

The all metal grill with a stainless steel lid features a handle and panel for durability with a stylish look.

The spacious primary cooking surface area is made of porcelain coated cast iron grates. And in case its large size is not enough, it also has a swing-away secondary cooking surface also coated in porcelain.

In addition, it comes equipped with a side burner so you can cook your favorite side dishes and sauces while you’re grilling. If you need more preparation space, the side burner has a lid so it can double as a side panel.

Since the grill is very large and heavy it comes equipped with wheels in case you ever need to move it around.

Pros

  • Durable, sturdy metal build
  • A large cooking area with enough power
  • Easy to set up

Cons

  • Large size takes a lot of space
  • It’s heavy, so it’s not easy to move around
  • Side panels do not fold down
  • Difficult access to the propane gas.
Check Price on Amazon

5. Master Cook Outdoor BBQ 4-Burner Cabinet Propane Gas Grill with Side Burner

This grill features a four-burner system for those looking to grill with the maximum amount of power. It is manufactured by Master Cook and is very similar in style and features to the one we just discussed. The price point is also very similar.

This is not only a high-performance grill but also contains high durability. The lid, UFC, and fascia are all constructed in stainless steel so it’s tough enough to face any weather.

The four tube burners provide evenly-distributed heat across all the main cooking surface areas equipped with heavy duty cast iron grates. There is also a secondary porcelain coated cooking rack for warming up or cooking foods that don’t require direct heat.

There are two side panels which include a side burner that can be covered, doubling as use for extra working space. Hooks are provided to hang your cooking utensils as well.

But no two grills are exactly the same. Naturally, there are some differences. This grill is large, but not too heavy, so moving around shouldn’t be too much of a chore. It includes four wheels for this purpose.

It also provides a large storage cabinet with doors, which means you don’t have to go around your grill to reach what’s inside.

Pros

  • Precise temperature controls for easy adjustment
  • Produces a bluer flame, which cooks better
  • Storage cabinet accessible from the front

Cons

  • Side panels are not foldable
  • Large size not suitable for small decks or patios
Check Price on Amazon

So, what’s the best gas grill under $500?

So we have covered the best Gas Grills under $500 that are available for purchase in 2018. We’ve gone from the grills that strongly favor style to grills that are more about performance.

All of these grills are budget-friendly, so you don’t have to break the bank to acquire a nice model fit to suit your grilling needs.

Determining the best grill under $500 for 2018 is really up to you. Make sure you make a list of the features you are wanting to best suit your needs before making a positive decision on a new grill.

We can tell you that the Char-Broil four-burner is a great grill for its value and contains lots of cooking space where you can grill for the whole family or at any gathering.

But of course, there other considerations to be taken into account such as space availability and mobility. The Char-Broil is not the best choice if you require a grill with these characteristics. In that case, you’d be better off with something like the Fuego Element grill.

We want to make sure you have all your ducks in a row and have been educated on all the details and functions before you make a decision on which grill to purchase. Whether it’s your first grill or if you are wanting to replace an older model, spend the time to research before you pull the trigger on the best gas grill under $500.

What Can You Expect from Gas Grills under $500?

Of course, you could always go with the classic charcoal grill. But there is so much more work that goes into charcoal grilling. You have to buy charcoal briquets and lighter fluid for everytime you grill. Plus in order to start the grill, you will have to wait about twenty minutes.

There will also be a lot of cleanups involved such as disposal of the grease and charcoal ash pans. With a gas grill, certain functions automatically trump the charcoal grill for convenience and time. One button to start with no waiting. One tank to be purchased for hours of grilling. And lastly, no cleanup.

Now don’t think that if you buy a cheaper grill you won’t have all the bells and whistles that come with an expensive grill. A grill with a reasonable price point can still feature a stylish design and withstand tough weather. Some of these grill options can also be space efficient and light.

Spending money on a bbq grill under 500 dollars will get you some of the most advanced gas grill models currently available. So, what are some of the things to consider when purchasing one? Let’s take a quick look:

The Special Features

Most grills come equipped with the most basic needs. And there are some that can come with an array of special features. Your best bet is to choose a grill that comes with special features that fit your cooking style.

If you want to cook all types of meat at once, go for one with infinite control valve adjustability. Some grills come equipped with a hot box connected to the side of the grill which uses indirect heat allowing you to smoke meats like Pork shoulder and beef brisket. Other grills have stovetops connected to them which allows you to cook with a skillet or pot while grilling at the same time.

The Cooking Surface Area

The cooking area is one of the most important aspects of a gas grill. The number of people you plan on cooking for will give you a good idea. Obtaining a grill with enough cooking surface space will help you to fulfill your home party and BBQ needs.

The Size

The actual size of a grill can range from compact and portable to very large which can become difficult to maneuver. Choosing the correct grill size also directly correlates with the grill’s cooking surface area.

So, keeping all these factors in mind, let’s check out the best value gas grills above. Good luck to you and happy grilling!
